intro: Shuteria longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed shuteria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Shuteria longipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and natural habitats across southern Europe.
